result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Returned Notice of Hearing for SEH 10-24-2022. (Doc 32)
Returned Order for PSI

3:13 PM Called 22CF10 for Plea hearing.  Defendant Robert Thomas Joyce appeared by video in custody from Hennepin Co. Jail in MN.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Robert Thomas Joyce. The parties have reached an agreement. Court reviews def's right to be here in person, def understands and waives right to in person appearance, requests to appear by video.   Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak. Amended count 1 & 5 for misd theft, counts 2 & 3 as charged, count 4 DRI.  Jointly ask for PSI, stipulate to $1,423.97 restitution, free to argue sentence, but agree to run concurrent to all counts and MN sentence.
Court questions def on serving time in MN, currently in because of high bond.  State moves to amend count 1 to misdemeanor, court grants.  Court reviews PLQ with def, Attny Pollak confirms he reviewed PLQ word for word with def and had permission by phone to electronically sign PLQ.  
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court reviews each charge and what the state would have to prove, possible max penalties.  If def is not currently serving a sentence the Judge cannot order a concurrent sentence.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.
Court reviews the PC statement, def confirms he reviewed with attny, and for the most part those facts are accurate. Attny confirms may use the PC statement to find probable cause.
 Court asks for plea. 
Def enters a plea of Guilty to amended count 1 misdemeanor theft, count 2 take and drive a car without consent felony, count 3 take and drive a car without consent felony & count 5 misdemeanor theft.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended count 1, counts 2, 3 & 5; count 4 is DRI and orders a JOC. State confirms vic rights compliance.  Def would like to have sentencing in person.  
Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present, but should be available by phone- if needed- for sentencing hearing.  Bond continues.  Def to stay in touch with Attny, if in custody for SEH will arrange to get him here, if he is out of custody must appear in person.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Offer contemplates PSI.  Def willing to enter plea via Zoom.  Stipulation has been made for $1423.97 restitution w/co-defendant with E.W.

NG plea entered to all counts. Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints. Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:33 AM Called 22CF10 for PH.  Defendant, Robert Thomas Joyce, appeared by phone with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak by video.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State in person.  Off the record updated def's contact info.  Attny Pollak and def appear by zoom with approval of the court.  Scheduled for PH, Attny Pollack confirms this will be a WOPH.  States asks about 4 Corners Motion, Attny Pollak replies that based on amended complaint they withdraw motion.    Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State efiles information which mirrors the criminal complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:05 PM Defendant Robert Thomas Joyce in court with attorney Alysja Otten appearing specially in place of Gabriel Pollak.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Robert Thomas Joyce appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def to be out of custody on 3/9/22, WTLPH.  NG pleas to misdemeanors.  Atty Otten notes Pollak filed 4 corners motion, requesting motion hearing.  State requests bond with no contact w/victims or E.W. (22CF09).  Court orders $5k signature bond- no contact with victims or E.W. and must remain living with parents until otherwise ordered by this Court.  No contact with Burnett County except for court-related purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
